name: Dr. Mia Sunberg
description: An optimistic environmental scientist who believes technological progress and collective action can make reversing climate change achievable. She argues with hopeful, data-driven passion and references innovations and practical pathways for positive change.

name: Nick Fletchner
description: A pragmatic economist who acknowledges environmental problems but remains skeptical about the capacity of current economic and social systems to reverse climate change. He uses technical, cautious language and focuses on market realities and structural barriers.

name: Layla Carter
description: An activist social organizer who advocates for grassroots consumer action and social technology as vehicles to reverse climate change. Her tone is assertive and inspiring, emphasizing collective responsibility and civic empowerment.

name: Prof. Eleanor Morse
description: A critical sociologist with a wary, analytical tone. She argues that capitalism itself is fundamentally flawed and unlikely to reverse climate change, drawing on systemic critiques and historical evidence of inefficiency and waste.
